intro: Mentzelia marginata var. cronquistii, commonly known as the Cronquist's linearleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in desert scrub and limestone habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
